definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: soorn (NH id.; vb. not in cognates; cf. Ph. [[מלץ]] interpreter CIS:22; CIS:44; CIS:88; Ar. la0s.a is turn aside (intrans.); hence perh. prop. speak indirectly or obliquely, Fl:De Pr 1:6);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 3 m. [[לַחְתָּ]] Pr 9:12; Impf. [[יׇלִיץ]] Pr 3:34 + 2 t.; Pt. [[לֵץ]] Pr 9:7 + 11 t.; pl. [[לֵחִים]] Ps 1:1 + 3 t.;—scorn, [[וְלַחְתָּ לְבַדְְּ]] [[תִשָּׂא]] Pr 9:12 if thou scornest thou alone shalt bear it (opp. [[חָכַמְתָּ]]), c. acc. Pr 14:9, Pr 19:28; c. [[לְ]], [[לַלֵּחִים]] [[הוּא־יׇלִיץ]] scorners he (God) scorneth Pr 3:34; [[הַלֵּץ]] the scorner is proud and haughty Pr 21:24, delights in scorning Pr 1:22, is incapable of discipline Pr 9:7, reproof Pr 9:8, Pr 15:12, or rebuke Pr 13:1, cannot find wisdom Pr 14:6; is an abomination Pr 24:9, should be avoided Ps 1:1; smitten and punished for the benefit of the simple Pr 19:25, Pr 21:11 and banished for the removal of contention Pr 22:10; judgment is prepared for him Pr 19:29; ‖[[עָרִיץ]] Is 29:20; wine is a scorner Pr 20:1.—
Pt. interpreter Ge 42:23 (E); fig. of intermediaries between God and man, Job 33:28, Is 43:27; ambassador 2Ch 32:31.

definitions.title: Poïlel
definitions.body: Pt. pl. [[לֽעֲחִים]] ([[מְ]] dropped Kö:ii. 479) scorners Ho 7:5.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. [[תִּתְלוֹחָָחוּ]] act as a scorner, shew oneself a mocker, Is 28:22.
